content:
SVG files can contain text to be rendered into glyphs. In the case of the {JS} SVGs for JavaScript_pi v2.0.2, they are very complicated and do contain the characters { S V and { again. The last is presumably to be mirrored to }. They are to be rendered in Arial font. I guess the issue is that that this is no longer working.
The SVG I sent you has only vectors. I will have a go at generating glyph-only SVGs later today.

With large size icons (700 pixels) I imported a png with text. Using inkscape I used "tracebitmap" to convert the text to a path. Removed the bitmap. The attached work with Windows.
If there are concerns about the icon for the plugins panel being png this could also be converted to svg.
icon.data.zip
Tests were done with a fork made this morning of your branch v2.0.2-wx3.2.
So no need for your work to remove the SVG stuff?

Toolbar icon oddity
On two OCPN5.7 Beta 4 installations, the toolbar icons behave differently.
I have copied the libJavaScript_pi.dylib and the data folder containing the icons across from one to the other, so I am certain I am running exactly the same versions.

On MacOS Ventura on both ARM and Intel systems, the toolbar icons are correct.
On an earlier MacOS Catalina, the untoggled JS icon is entirely black and the letters undecernable. The toggled icon is correct with the white letters on a grey background.
Hunch: might the letters on the untoggled icon be relying on a default colour rather than being explicitly set white?
